name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim-Main Gate Area

reviews.title: Awesome stay!
reviews.text: Stayed here for four days while visiting Disneyland. It's a definite keeper and we will return. Great value for all that is included. Only downside was not having any kind of accurate TV channel guide available.....the one night we were back early from the park and could have used it.... and housekeeping missing our room one day. Great breakfast each morning and evening dinner served Mon-Thurs. The best quality with all the amenities at a reasonable price in the area. Loved it!

We had a great trip to Disneyland and enjoyed our stay at Homewood Suites mid-September. Having breakfast included everyday was a huge convenience and savings. The shuttle service was reliable and convenient. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Value.

reviews.text: Hotel was awesome! Service was awesome! Loved how close it was to both Disneyland AND Knott's! Appreciated how after 2 long days I was STRESSFREE knowing we were coming back to relax, clean up, and sleep in your hotel. We can't wait to come back!
reviews.title: Can't wait to come back!

reviews.text: We stayed at this property from 24 September for four nights with our three children and I have to say this place was without a doubt the highlight of our USA holiday when it comes to accommodation. As do most families, we visited Anaheim purely for the Disneyland experience and after choosing to stay at Homewood after reading many favorable reveiws on Trip Advisor it didnt take long to realise that this place lived up to everything that we had read on TA. The two young guys on reception have the best customer service skills I have ever come across, extremely friendly and very willing to help as were the rest of the staff including the lady who served us complimentary beers during the managers reception/dinner. The free meals (Managers reception & Breakfast) were more than adequate, anyone who complains about the quality of what is dished up is simply being unreasonable, ok it is served on throw away plates with plastic cutlery but dont forget... it isnt 5 star but for the price you pay and for what you get, it realy is an absolute bargain. We stayed in 5 star at the next place we visited for the next few nights after checking out of Homewood and there was simply NO comparision. The lift (elevator) is not as slow as people make out, there a wait but its not that long, if you are impaitent by nature take a walk to the other end and use the lift that nobody else uses... it will be waiting for you!
reviews.title: Homely & Friendly Enviroment

reviews.text: The laundry is adequate and prices very reasonable.
reviews.title: Don't go anywhere else!

reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised at the size of the rooms. We had a one bedroom (2 queen beds) with the full kitchenette. Although we did not do any 'real' cooking we did find it convenient to be able to keep drinks, snacks, and left overs in the fridge. The provided breakfast every morning had good variety and some healthy options which was nice. Overall, the room was cleaned to a decent standard each day.
reviews.title: Great week at Homewood Suites!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel, just a few short blocks from the Magic Kingdom, was better than I could have possibly imagined. At half the price of the Disney Hotels, this residence delivered more than twice the amenities! Stay here!!!
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: This was our second time staying at the Homewood Suites while visiting Disneyland. It had been a couple of years since our last stay, so I checked TripAdvisor first before booking it again. I was a little apprehensive after reading some of the negative reviews but after our stay I am very happy that we chose this hotel. The front desk staff was extremely friendly when we arrived. When I booked the hotel, the only room available was a 2-queen room, so I requested a 1-king room which they were able to accommodate. The breakfast and dinner that is included really helped control expenses and while it wasn't the most amazing tasting, it was decent food and there were a lot of choices. The free beer and wine are also a plus during the evening reception. We bought season passes on this trip and will likely be choosing this hotel for all of our future visits.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Being a Hilton honours member I was greatly disappointed. We stayed at the Homewood suite in Orlando Florida and booked this one because of our great experience in Florida. The staff were really friendly, but definitely under staffed. The phones in the rooms (and I say roomS because we were in a few) didn't work. And because the main elevator was so slow we had to run up and down the stairs to ask the front desk a question. Also used the stairs daily to leave and return from the hotel. There is another elevator that's down an extremely long and dark hallway which is pretty much on the other side of the hotel. The welcome back dinners were good, but there wasn't much varity at breakfast (with it being a Hilton chain). We paid the extra amount and got a larger suite (which is the standard size in Florida). The first day the room was cleaned well and they sent up a playpen for the baby to sleep in. But the air condition in the bedroom was so cold and just blasted out the air, it was too cold for the baby. On our third last day we got a knock at our door in the morning.....an employee asked if I could check my washroom cause the room beside us was "backed up". Because it was pretty early no one had even used the washroom yet, most were still sleeping. So when I checked sure enough there was black stuff coming up out of our bathtub. He said that they would take care of everything while we were out that day. When we returned later that day from the beach, it was like we had walked into a murder scene (substituting red blood for black tar). It was ALL over the bathtub, the washroom walls and floor. When we went down the stairs to talk to front desk they asked if we could change rooms, saying that plumbers need to come back the next day to fix it. They gave us two rooms to check out, one being on the 5th floor which we remembered from previous reviews, was a smoking floor and was also a regular size suite. The minute I opened the door we didn't even have to walk in you could still smell the scent of cigarettes. The second room was on the 3rd floor and was a larger suite, but was right below the room were the problem originated.....we even questioned if it would be a problem. The front desk and an employee (that actually check out the room) assured us it wouldn't be.....So doubtfully we went with the 3rd floor suite only because we can't handle the smell of cigarettes (personal and because we were travelling with kids). Well after moving everything over we decided to give the kids a bath. While bathing them, drips of water were falling into the bathtub...we looked up to find the ceiling leaking. Again back down the stairs, (phone in this room didn't work as well) and they gave us a key to another suite just so we could shower. The next day we went about our day and were told the leak would be looked at while we were gone....We returned and the whole bathroom was a mess, there now was a hole cut out above the shower and above the toilet. And this time they didn't not care that we had items in the washroom and they didn't move them. Back down to the desk (via stairs) I told them I would just shower in the other room they gave us and they responded with oh no that room is no longer available...??? Fine but they didn't inform us that our "showering room" was no longer ours to use. So they again asked us to move. This time because they were no more larger suites available they were going to offer us two rooms. We didn't take two rooms, I didn't want the kids running back and forth in the hallway. It was nice of them to offer, but by this point we just wanted to quickly move our stuff over and not have to again. Doesn't sound like a lot to move rooms, but when you have now stayed for almost a week, there were things in the drawers, closets, fridge, freezer and cupboards. Not to mention 3 young children and a slow elevator. This was all obviously very unfortunately and something no one was expecting, but because the hotel was under staffed things weren't quickly looked at. There were also little things that weren't too appealing, like garbage bags at the end of the hallways filled and left there, our room was really only cleaned well the first day, the phones not working, and charging for the shuttle bus to Disney as well as parking in the hotel parking lot. I've stayed at quite a few Hilton hotels for personal and business and wouldn't recommend this one, it unfortunately left a bad last impression. I really hope things change for this hotel cause it could be a great hotel.
reviews.title: Could be a great hotel.....but

reviews.text: I have never stayed at a Homewood Suites before yesterday, but was pleasantly surprised at all the perks a person receives at the hotel. There is a full kitchen in the room, a nice desk, two couches and a king size bed. Each room has a TV and the room was very clean. The biggest surprise was a "dinner" that is served for free from 5-7. The night we were there they were serving a taco dinner.....all you can eat. I had a good salad. They were also serving beer and wine, along with a selection of pop. A breakfast is served in the AM. There is a bus to Disneyland. We didn't use it but walked about 1.5 miles to look at the Disneyland hotels. The staff was very pleasant and the maid service was efficient. The pool was great for kids. Although we are bringing our family to the Disneyland hotel next year, we were very impressed with this hotel and highly recommend it for families who want all the amenities at a lesser cost.
reviews.title: Great hotel for families

reviews.text: My room and the hotel itself were extremely clean. I enjoyed having a kitchenette in the room. The kitchenette includes a full fridge, cooktop, microwave and dishwasher. The hotel serves a free breakfast daily which has some hot items. The breakfast is okay, not great. I was surprised that I did not see fresh fruit at the breakfast but maybe I just missed that. As an added bonus, the hotel also serves a free dinner Monday through Thursday. I saw the Thursday night dinner, it was nothing I would call exciting (salad, rolls, ravioli) but this feature would sure help a family trying to save a bit of money on their Disney vacation.
reviews.title: Enjoyable experience

reviews.text: The hotel is across the street from a Target store which makes it very easy to stock your kitchenette.
reviews.title: Great hotel...maybe not for the business traveler though...

reviews.text: The staff were pleasant and helpful. The beds and bedding were comfortable.
reviews.title: Just like Home
Excellent value
reviews.text: My two small complaints were that I had multiple people trying to reach me through the hotel line and they all told me the phone just kept ringing and no one was answering. One person did finally get through, so, I know I didn't give out the wrong number. The hotel might need to invest in an answering machine if staff are too busy to answer all the calls. The other minor thing is that there is no room safe.
The wifi in the hotel was excellent.
reviews.title: Convenient, decent stay

reviews.text: We stayed here for our kids' first Disney vacation. I was recommended to it by another friend, and it turned out to be one of the less expensive places around. The room was super clean, everything was very nice. Hotel staff was friendly and always quick to help. Breakfast was fantastic, not your usual toast and coffee but full eggs, waffles, meats, etc. And finally, they have a Disney shuttle that runs every half hour so you can avoid the parking madness! The fitness center and pool were also excellent. 10/10, would definitely stay again!
reviews.title: Clean rooms, friendly staff, awesome breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was impressed with all of the staff housekeeping was efficient and complete. We needed to have the feather comforters pillows removed due to allergies. The housekeeping staff were at our door almost as soon as we got to the room. The staff at breakfast and evening reception were always working cleaning or assisting customers. The front desk was very helpful and knowledgeable about the area Disney and other things. The shuttle service to Disneyland was on time and had very pleasant drivers.
reviews.title: great staff and service
Wonderful place to stay with a family
reviews.text: This hotel exceeded my expectations. we got the room that had a 2 queens and then had a seperate area with kitchen and couch etc... Was great to put the kids to bed and then close the door and stay up and watch TV and have some social time. Pool was excellent especially the kiddy pool Didn't have to worry about our kids in there. Food was good and the staff were super friendly.

Enjoyed my stay in this place. Reasonable price and close to all major motorway/highway. Staff was very nice and helpful also very warm and welcoming which made the stay a pleasant one. Rooms are a bit out dated and old fashion but nevertheless they make up for the service and facilities in the hotel.
reviews.title: A pleasant stay!
Surprisingly Quiet Rooms
reviews.text: Overall will definitely go there again!its been a pleasure staying with you guys!

aka: Homewood Suites By Hiltonr Anaheim-Main Gate Area Hotel
description: Extended stay suite hotel. An all-suites Anaheim hotel that will make you feel closer to home! The Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim-Main Gate Area hotel is one of the Disney Good Neighbor hotels, only a mile away. Enjoy complimentary Wi-Fi, daily breakfast and dinner Monday to Thursday.
